channel.title: BBC News - Europe

item.title: Austrian ex-far-right leader Strache guilty of corruption
item.description: The verdict comes two years after a video sting ended Heinz-Christian Strache's political career.

item.title: French woman arrested over jewellery thefts from coffins
item.description: Police believe the woman was posing as a mourner to strip valuables from the recently deceased.

item.title: French presidency: Michel Barnier joins race 'to change France'
item.description: The former EU Brexit negotiator says he will take on Emmanuel Macron in the elections next spring.

item.title: Afghans in Calais prepare to risk lives again to reach UK
item.description: Aid agencies on the French coast are preparing for a new influx of migrants trying to get to the UK.

item.title: Greenland island is world's northernmost island - scientists
item.description: They say a tiny island off Greenland's coast was discovered by luck during a recent expedition.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: How Man Utd pulled off shock transfer
item.description: BBC Sport's Simon Stone details the journey of Cristiano Ronaldo's shock return to Manchester United.

item.title: Brexit: Irish support for deal harming NI, says DUP leader
item.description: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson's claim comes after a meeting with Taoiseach Micheál Martin in Dublin.

item.title: Young Afghan mayor who fled Taliban hidden in car
item.description: One of Afghanistan's first female mayors, Zarifa Ghafari, describes her dramatic escape to Germany.

item.title: German elections 2021: Simple guide to vote ending Merkel era
item.description: Next month, Germans choose a new government. This is how the vote works.

item.title: Mass brawl erupts in Armenian parliament: Third violent bout in just two days
item.description: Security personnel were called in to remove several members after violence erupted on the parliament floor.

item.title: Why rent control isn’t working in Sweden
item.description: Young people are struggling to afford city living, and even the Swedes can't crack the problem.

item.title: Stalin-era mass grave found in Ukraine
item.description: Thousands of people are thought to be buried at the site - one of the largest ever found in Ukraine.

item.title: The hard men removing squatters in Spain
item.description: Some squatters in Spain demand cash before leaving - so eviction firms have arisen to handle the talks.

item.title: Migrant crossings: What happens to migrants who reach the UK?
item.description: The government wants to cut the number of migrants crossing the Channel.

item.title: Cows on the moo-ve from Swiss Alpine meadow
item.description: Some cows are carried by helicopter in a process used by farmers to move the injured ones.

item.title: Could this solar farm be a climate change solution?
item.description: UN experts say rapid innovative solutions are needed to end our dependency on fossil fuels. Could this new project provide an answer?

item.title: Afghan para-athlete Nilofar Bayat welcomed by new team in Spain
item.description: Nilofar Bayat, Afghan wheelchair basketball women's captain, is in Bilbao after fleeing the Taliban.

item.title: Wildfires rage across Europe
item.description: A look at some of the fires spreading across Europe - and the rest of the globe.

item.title: Afghan reporter asks Nato secretary general for help
item.description: Lailuma Sadid, a journalist with Brussels Morning Newspaper, became emotional when asking the Nato secretary general about the Taliban in Afghanistan.
